user.description: Diederik P. Kingma. Research Scientist in Machine Learning at OpenAI

text: @ulizyh KL(q(x,z)||p(x,z)) = KL(q(x)||p(x)) + E_{q(x)}[ KL(q(z|x)||p(z|x)) ] = KL(q(z)||p(z)) + E_{q(z)}[ KL(q(x|z)||p(x|z)) ]

user.name: Durk Kingma
user.description: Diederik P. Kingma. Research Scientist in Machine Learning at OpenAI

text: @ulizyh Yes; KL(q(x,z)||p(x,z)) can be rewritten as sums of (expected) KL divergences of marginals and conditionals.
